intro: Taeniopsis furcata, commonly known as the forked taeniopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with a fine pubescence. Taeniopsis furcata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
